title: The Best Bluetooth Trackers In 2024
description: Stop losing things and going crazy over finding them. Buy a tracker and keep your sanity.
author: Irene Okpanachi
excerpt: Stop losing things and going crazy over finding them. Buy a tracker and keep your sanity.
text: Oftentimes, I spend minutes tearing apart the house, looking for my phone, only to find it in my hands or right in front of me when I've settled down. If you're like me, you'd want to buy a Bluetooth tracker to find important items that are easy to misplace, like your car keys, wallet, or even a whole bag.  These small devices connect to your phone via Bluetooth, allowing you to locate your stuff using an app. You can ping the tracker to make it ring or use a dedicated app to see the missing object's last known location. Some trackers even help you find your phone by pressing a button. If you're shopping online for the best ones, look no further than these top options for Android.  Overview of the top Android Bluetooth trackers Best overall tracker: Tile Pro. Best compatibility with Google Find My Device: Chipolo One Point. Best for Galaxy phones: Samsung Galaxy SmartTag 2. Best tracker for pets: Fi Smart Dog Collar Series 3. Best versatile tracker: Motorola Moto Tag. Best tracker for accessibility: Pebblebee. Best trackers for kids: Fitbit Ace LTE. Tile Pro 2024 Image: Tile Pros Syncs with Amazon Alexa & Google Assistant for voice commanding. Long range of up to 500 ft. Loud 110dB+ sound.  Replaceable battery & water resistance. Cons Slightly bulkier than most Bluetooth trackers. Expensive for a small device. ComponentSpecificationDimensions34.0 mm x 52.1 mm x 7.5 mmWeight12 gRange500 ft / 152 mVolume110 dB+Battery lifeOne year (replaceable)Price $34.99 The Tile Pro Bluetooth tracker offers numerous reasons to buy it. For one, it has a range of 500 feet, so even if your keys or wallet are buried under the couch or forgotten in another room, you can find them easily with the attached tile. With the Tile app, you can either track the object's last location or trigger a 110dB alert sound.  110dB is very loud, about the volume of a live rock concert or a chainsaw at close range. Finding your missing object's a great feature, even in noisy environments. Another big plus is its water resistance. The Tile Pro can handle being dropped in water up to five feet deep. It also has a replaceable battery that lasts up to a year.  You can always swap it out and keep using it instead of buying a new tracker, which is a huge money saver. The SOS feature adds a layer of security: You can use the Tile to send out a distress signal and reach out for help in unexpected situations. Chipolo One Point Image: Chipotle Pros Smooth integration with Google Find My Device  Louder sound than the Tile Pro. Replaceable battery. Durable design & water resistance. Cons Requires location services. It may drain the battery quicker. Pricey for a small device. ComponentSpecificationDimensions0.25 inches x 1.49 inchesWeight~7.5g Range200ft / 60mVolume 120 dB+Battery lifeOne year (replaceable)Price $27.99 The Chipolo One Point tracker works well with Google's Find My Device network, allowing you to locate your items on Google Maps and get precise directions. It has a maximum volume of up to 120dB, higher than the Tile Pro. The tracker also provides distance hints through the app, which is a fun way of pinpointing the exact location of your item as you get closer. The One Point tracker is also durable and water-resistant, with an IPX5 rating. It's not as resistant as the Tile Pro, but it can withstand splashes and light rain. Its design shares similarities with Apple's AirTag, making it a decent alternative for Android users.  Both trackers are circular, but the One Point is slightly thicker and has a keyring hole for easy attachment, while the AirTag is designed with a polished stainless steel finish that gives it a more premium look. Samsung Galaxy SmartTag 2 Image: Samsung Pros Longest battery life on this list. IP67 water resistance. Better range & precision with UWB technology than most trackers. Relatively affordable. Cons Only works with Samsung devices. Doesn't support Google Find My Device network  Requires Android 11 or higher OS. Volume isn't loud enough. ComponentSpecificationDimensions28.8 x 52.44 x 8.0 mmWeight~13.75 g RangeUp to 120 mVolumeBuzzerBattery lifeUp to 500 days (replaceable)Price $29.99 The Galaxy SmartTag 2 is a product developed by Samsung. It’s designed to work exclusively within the Galaxy ecosystem through the SmartThings app. When you misplace your belongings, the SmartTag2 can track their current location accurately.  Features like Compass View use ultra-wideband (UWB) technology to guide you directly to the tag's location. With a simple click, you can control various IoT devices. So, in addition to locating lost items, you can also manage connected smart devices like lights and thermostats. Like the Chipolo One Point, the SmartTag 2 provides helpful on-screen arrows with the Search Nearby feature. It points you in the right direction, and you can ring the tag. Plus, when you activate Lost Mode, the tag displays your contact information on someone else’s phone, making it easier for them to return your lost item.  It will broadcast a signal, and the finder will see the information as a notification when they scan nearby Bluetooth devices and connect them to the tag. It doesn't matter if they use an iPhone or Android device. The SmartTag 2 works with any Galaxy smartphone or tablet running Android 11 or later, but if you want to take full advantage of its features, your phone or tablet must support ultra-wideband (UWB). One major downside is that the tracker's sound level is around 65.7 dB, comparable to a normal conversation or background music. It’s generally considered a moderate noise level and is not loud enough to cause discomfort or hearing damage. So you need to be a good eavesdropper or attentive listener to hear it, especially in a noisy environment. Fi Smart Dog Collar Series 3 Image: Fi Pros User-friendly tracking app to match. Precise & real-time GPS tracking. Health & activity monitoring. Waterproof & lightweight design. Cons No one-time purchase. Requires subscription. Expensive. It features a combination of satellite, Bluetooth, and cell network, so you can locate your dog in real-time if they escape your sight. It beats microchips implanted under a dog’s skin because if a lost dog is found, someone needs to take it to a vet or animal control to have the chip scanned, which can take time and doesn’t provide immediate location tracking. In contrast, the Fi collar continuously monitors your dog, no matter how far they wander. The tracker is designed to look like a collar but with advanced capabilities. The collar is also waterproof, with an IP68 resistance rating, and can withstand swimming in fresh and saltwater. The 500+ lbs resistance of the Fi collar is another great benefit because it’s strong enough for powerful dogs that like to pull or chew. If you have a big dog, like a Labrador or a German Shepherd, the collar won’t break easily.  Motorola Moto Tag Image: Motorola Pros Affordable compared to other Bluetooth trackers. The new tracker helps you to find anything easily, whether it’s your keys, backpack, or even your pet. The design is small and it comes in two vibrant colors. With options like Starlight Blue and Sage Green, the tracker serves an aesthetic appeal and matches your outfits.  It also has a multifunction button, which acts as a remote shutter for your Android device’s camera. You can press it to take group photos or selfies without holding your phone, making it easier to capture special moments. Like Samsung's SmartTag 2, it supports Ultra-Wideband (UWB) technology, which provides more accurate location tracking than standard Bluetooth.  Thanks to Google's Fast Pair technology, setting up the Moto Tag is easy. So, you can use your existing keychains, adhesive mounts, or wallet holders to easily attach your Moto Tag to your keys, bags, or even your laptop. Its rechargeable battery lasts up to 12 months, which means you won’t need to keep buying new batteries that harm the environment. It supports multi-sensory alerts, which combine a loud buzzer with bright lights. These alerts help you find your items in busy or dark places, especially if you have vision or hearing problems. Fitbit Ace LTE Image: Google Pros Water resistant up to 50 m. Supports calls & messages with a built-in microphone & speakers. Eco-friendly material. Fitness & activity monitoring. Cons Requires the Ace Pass data plan. Can only contact 20 people maximum. Requires a compatible phone running Android 11 or higher. Expensive. More importantly, they can get lost themselves. That’s one of the main reasons why a tracker for kids is useful. The Fitbit Ace LTE is designed specially for that purpose.  It's part of Google's fitness product line, offering fitness tracking, movement-based games, parental controls, and LTE connectivity for calling, messaging, and location sharing. This way, you can always communicate with your kids and know where they are without worry. Range is key for Bluetooth trackers Now, you can find a tracker that fits your budget and needs. The most important thing to check before making a purchase is the range. After all, it's what locates your phone from a distance. That is, how far your phone can be from the tracker while still maintaining a connection.  Most Bluetooth trackers offer a range between 100 to 500 feet. For everyday use, such as finding keys or a wallet indoors, a shorter range of around 100 to 200 feet works fine. However, for larger spaces or outdoor areas, a longer range closer to 400 or 500 feet is ideal.
html:
Oftentimes, I spend minutes tearing apart the house, looking for my phone, only to find it in my hands or right in front of me when I've settled down. If you're like me, you'd want to buy a Bluetooth tracker to find important items that are easy to misplace, like your car keys, wallet, or even a whole bag. 

These small devices connect to your phone via Bluetooth, allowing you to locate your stuff using an app. You can ping the tracker to make it ring or use a dedicated app to see the missing object's last known location. Some trackers even help you find your phone by pressing a button. If you're shopping online for the best ones, look no further than these top options for Android. 

Overview of the top Android Bluetooth trackers

  1. Best overall tracker: Tile Pro.
  2. Best compatibility with Google Find My Device: Chipolo One Point.
  3. Best for Galaxy phones: Samsung Galaxy SmartTag 2.
  4. Best tracker for pets: Fi Smart Dog Collar Series 3.
  5. Best versatile tracker: Motorola Moto Tag.
  6. Best tracker for accessibility: Pebblebee.
  7. Best trackers for kids: Fitbit Ace LTE.

Tile Pro 2024

Pros

  • Syncs with Amazon Alexa & Google Assistant for voice commanding.
  • Long range of up to 500 ft.
  • Loud 110dB+ sound. 
  • Replaceable battery & water resistance.

Cons

  • Slightly bulkier than most Bluetooth trackers.
  • Expensive for a small device.

    The Tile Pro Bluetooth tracker offers numerous reasons to buy it. For one, it has a range of 500 feet, so even if your keys or wallet are buried under the couch or forgotten in another room, you can find them easily with the attached tile. With the Tile app, you can either track the object's last location or trigger a 110dB alert sound. 

    110dB is very loud, about the volume of a live rock concert or a chainsaw at close range. Finding your missing object's a great feature, even in noisy environments. Another big plus is its water resistance. The Tile Pro can handle being dropped in water up to five feet deep. It also has a replaceable battery that lasts up to a year. 

    You can always swap it out and keep using it instead of buying a new tracker, which is a huge money saver. The SOS feature adds a layer of security: You can use the Tile to send out a distress signal and reach out for help in unexpected situations.

    Chipolo One Point

    Pros

    • Smooth integration with Google Find My Device 
    • Louder sound than the Tile Pro.
    • Replaceable battery.
    • Durable design & water resistance.

    Cons

    • Requires location services. It may drain the battery quicker.
    • Pricey for a small device.

    The Chipolo One Point tracker works well with Google's Find My Device network, allowing you to locate your items on Google Maps and get precise directions. It has a maximum volume of up to 120dB, higher than the Tile Pro. The tracker also provides distance hints through the app, which is a fun way of pinpointing the exact location of your item as you get closer.

        The One Point tracker is also durable and water-resistant, with an IPX5 rating. It's not as resistant as the Tile Pro, but it can withstand splashes and light rain. Its design shares similarities with Apple's AirTag, making it a decent alternative for Android users. 

        Both trackers are circular, but the One Point is slightly thicker and has a keyring hole for easy attachment, while the AirTag is designed with a polished stainless steel finish that gives it a more premium look.

        Samsung Galaxy SmartTag 2

        Pros

        • Longest battery life on this list.
        • IP67 water resistance.
        • Better range & precision with UWB technology than most trackers.
        • Relatively affordable.

        Cons

        • Only works with Samsung devices.
        • Doesn't support Google Find My Device network 
        • Requires Android 11 or higher OS.
        • Volume isn't loud enough.

        The Galaxy SmartTag 2 is a product developed by Samsung. It’s designed to work exclusively within the Galaxy ecosystem through the SmartThings app. When you misplace your belongings, the SmartTag2 can track their current location accurately. 

          Features like Compass View use ultra-wideband (UWB) technology to guide you directly to the tag's location. With a simple click, you can control various IoT devices. So, in addition to locating lost items, you can also manage connected smart devices like lights and thermostats.

          Like the Chipolo One Point, the SmartTag 2 provides helpful on-screen arrows with the Search Nearby feature. It points you in the right direction, and you can ring the tag. Plus, when you activate Lost Mode, the tag displays your contact information on someone else’s phone, making it easier for them to return your lost item. 

          It will broadcast a signal, and the finder will see the information as a notification when they scan nearby Bluetooth devices and connect them to the tag. It doesn't matter if they use an iPhone or Android device. The SmartTag 2 works with any Galaxy smartphone or tablet running Android 11 or later, but if you want to take full advantage of its features, your phone or tablet must support ultra-wideband (UWB).

          One major downside is that the tracker's sound level is around 65.7 dB, comparable to a normal conversation or background music. It’s generally considered a moderate noise level and is not loud enough to cause discomfort or hearing damage. So you need to be a good eavesdropper or attentive listener to hear it, especially in a noisy environment.

          Fi Smart Dog Collar Series 3

          Pros

          • User-friendly tracking app to match.
          • Precise & real-time GPS tracking.
          • Health & activity monitoring.
          • Waterproof & lightweight design.

          Cons

          • No one-time purchase. Requires subscription.
          • Expensive.

          Dogs often wander off when they don’t have their collars, making the Fi collar tracker a great tool for dog owners. It features a combination of satellite, Bluetooth, and cell network, so you can locate your dog in real-time if they escape your sight. It beats microchips implanted under a dog’s skin because if a lost dog is found, someone needs to take it to a vet or animal control to have the chip scanned, which can take time and doesn’t provide immediate location tracking.

          In contrast, the Fi collar continuously monitors your dog, no matter how far they wander. The tracker is designed to look like a collar but with advanced capabilities. It can check your dog's health and behavior, offering insights into their activity levels and sleep patterns. So, you'll notice any changes in their well-being.

          The collar is also waterproof, with an IP68 resistance rating, and can withstand swimming in fresh and saltwater. The battery life maxes out at three months, which is understandable as it's a larger tracker than others on this list and powers more features. But it supports wireless charging. 

          Additionally, you can make the collar light up at night. This way, it's easier to see your dog in dark places. The 500+ lbs resistance of the Fi collar is another great benefit because it’s strong enough for powerful dogs that like to pull or chew. If you have a big dog, like a Labrador or a German Shepherd, the collar won’t break easily. 

          Motorola Moto Tag

          Pros

          • Affordable compared to other Bluetooth trackers.
          • Supports advanced UWB technology.
          • Remote shutter feature for taking pictures.
          • Easy setup with Google Fast Pair.

          Cons

          • Requires Android devices with UWB support.
          • Limited color options (only Sage Green available for single units).

          This tracker is Motorola’s first, and it officially went on sale in August 2024. The new tracker helps you to find anything easily, whether it’s your keys, backpack, or even your pet. The design is small and it comes in two vibrant colors. With options like Starlight Blue and Sage Green, the tracker serves an aesthetic appeal and matches your outfits. 

          It also has a multifunction button, which acts as a remote shutter for your Android device’s camera. You can press it to take group photos or selfies without holding your phone, making it easier to capture special moments. Like Samsung's SmartTag 2, it supports Ultra-Wideband (UWB) technology, which provides more accurate location tracking than standard Bluetooth. 

          Thanks to Google's Fast Pair technology, setting up the Moto Tag is easy. Just turn it on and bring it close to a compatible phone, and it will prompt you to connect automatically. If you already have AirTag accessories, you’re in luck. The Moto Tag is actually compatible with Apple AirTag accessories. So, you can use your existing keychains, adhesive mounts, or wallet holders to easily attach your Moto Tag to your keys, bags, or even your laptop.

          Pebblebee Clip Universal

          Pros

          • Global compatibility with Google Find My Device.
          • Compact and lightweight design that easily attaches to items.
          • Rechargeable battery.
          • IPX6 water-resistant for everyday durability.
          • Privacy protection. No third-party access to tracking information.

          Cons

          • Lacks alerts for out-of-proximity notifications.
          • Limited integration with Android devices compared to iPhones.

          The Pebblebee tracker is a good choice because it’s eco-friendly. Its rechargeable battery lasts up to 12 months, which means you won’t need to keep buying new batteries that harm the environment. It supports multi-sensory alerts, which combine a loud buzzer with bright lights. These alerts help you find your items in busy or dark places, especially if you have vision or hearing problems.

          You just attach the tracker to something you want to track, connect it using an app, and you’re ready to go. Privacy is also another desirable feature of the Pebblebee tracker. It keeps your location data safe with end-to-end encryption, so only you can see where your items are. Pebblebee does not have access to this information and won’t sell it.

          Fitbit Ace LTE

          Pros

          • Water resistant up to 50 m.
          • Supports calls & messages with a built-in microphone & speakers.
          • Eco-friendly material.
          • Fitness & activity monitoring.

          Cons

          • Requires the Ace Pass data plan.
          • Can only contact 20 people maximum.
          • Requires a compatible phone running Android 11 or higher.
          • Expensive.

          Kids can be careless, often losing their backpacks, toys, or even lunchboxes. More importantly, they can get lost themselves. That’s one of the main reasons why a tracker for kids is useful. The Fitbit Ace LTE is designed specially for that purpose. 

          It's part of Google's fitness product line, offering fitness tracking, movement-based games, parental controls, and LTE connectivity for calling, messaging, and location sharing. This way, you can always communicate with your kids and know where they are without worry.

          Range is key for Bluetooth trackers

          Now, you can find a tracker that fits your budget and needs. The most important thing to check before making a purchase is the range. After all, it's what locates your phone from a distance. That is, how far your phone can be from the tracker while still maintaining a connection. 

          Most Bluetooth trackers offer a range between 100 to 500 feet. For everyday use, such as finding keys or a wallet indoors, a shorter range of around 100 to 200 feet works fine. However, for larger spaces or outdoor areas, a longer range closer to 400 or 500 feet is ideal.
